definition: lit. to follow the vine to get to the melon/to track sth following clues
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
to feel with the hand/to touch/to stroke/to grope/to steal/to abstract

sentences.english: The arrest of the driver, Tharin Gartrell, 28, led authorities to the two other men.
sentences.chinese: 之后警方顺藤摸瓜逮捕了另外两人。

sentences.english: I was able to track down the source of the problem and had it dealt with already.
sentences.chinese: 我顺藤摸瓜找到了问题的根源，也已经把它解决了。

sentences.english: We spent a few months was able to follow it.
sentences.chinese: 我们花费了数月才得以顺藤摸瓜。

sentences.english: He quickly tore open the wound, immediately instructed the crew to find out.
sentences.chinese: 他要迅速撕开这口子，顺藤摸瓜把水手找出来。

definition: to try to find out/to trace/to track down
(of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
lit. spider's thread and horse track/tiny hints (of a secret)/traces/clue
to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
